docs.snippet: It was just as well for the credit of our City Inspector that he had not (as he says) the "official data of the mortality of London for 1860," before he made out his report on the health of the City for the past year, as it must have modified very...
docs.lead_paragraph: It was just as well for the credit of our City Inspector that he had not (as he says) the "official data of the mortality of London for 1860," before he made out his report on the health of the City for the past year, as it must have modified very materially his statement that "the difference of mortality either way (between New-York and London) cannot be very great."

headline.main: An Interview with Garibaldi.; The following letter from Mr. JOHN M'ADAM, of Glasgow, to his brother, is published in the North British Mail:

headline.main: Anniversary of the New-York Woman's Hospital.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Sixth Annual Anniversary of the New-York Woman's Hospital was held at the Hospital, No. 83 Madison-avenue, on Saturday last, at 12 o'clock, Hon. JAMES W. BEEKMAN presiding. Rev. Mr. MONTGOMERY opened the proceedings with prayer. Mrs. DOREMUS read the Treasurer's Report, showing the receipts of the hospital for the year just past to have been $8,511 36, its disbursements $8,958 08, and the unpaid bills $726 88.

headline.main: LAW COURTS; THE MURDER TRAILS. Court of Oyer and Terminer. M'GUIRE CONVICTED OF MANSLAUGHTER IN THE THIRD DEGREE. HOCHREITTER SENTENCED FOR LIFE. BUCHANAN, THE TWELFTH-STREET MURDERER.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court, yesterday, before Judge LEONARD, the trial of John McGuire, for murder, was proceeded with. The testimony was all in on the previous day, and counsel for the defence now summed up to the jury, claiming that the proof had shown the prisoner to have been put in fear of his life by threats and attacks on the part of the deceased and his friends.
